sn4.9:1: Thus have I heard. On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the Squirrel Sanctuary. There the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus: "Bhikkhus!"
sn4.9:2: "Bhikkhus, this life span of human beings is short. One has to go on to the future life. One should do what is wholesome and lead the holy life; for one who has taken birth there is no avoiding death. One who lives long, bhikkhus, lives a hundred years or a little longer."
sn4.9:3: Then Māra the Evil One approached the Blessed One and addressed him in verse:
sn4.9:4: v.63"Long is the life span of human beings,The good man should not disdain it.One should live like a milk-sucking baby:Death has not made its arrival."[n.279]Spkparaphrases: "The good man should live like a baby who, after drinking milk, might lie down on a blanket and fall asleep, unconcerned whether life is long or short."
sn4.9:5: v.464"Short is the life span of human beings,The good man should disdain it.One should live like one with head aflame:There is no avoiding Death's arrival."
sn4.9:6: Then Māra the Evil One … disappeared right there.
